channel.title: Comments on: Part 2 of 7: Rav Soloveitchik- Religious Definitions of Man and his Social Institutions (1958)
channel.description: notes on Jewish theology and spirituality

item.title: By: Alan Brill
item.dc:creator: Alan Brill
item.description: As a side note to all this, the auction house Kestenbaum and Company is auctioning this Wednesday a copy of Heschel's Torah min HaShamayim autographed by Heschel as a gift to Soloveitchik.
item.content:encoded: As a side note to all this, the auction house Kestenbaum and Company is auctioning this Wednesday a copy of Heschel’s Torah min HaShamayim autographed by Heschel as a gift to Soloveitchik.

item.title: By: Lawrence Kaplan
item.dc:creator: Lawrence Kaplan
item.description: Unfortunately, I do not know the answers to the questions in your last sentence. I hope to comment more fully once I have had the chance to hear the whole lecture.
item.content:encoded: Unfortunately, I do not know the answers to the questions in your last sentence. I hope to comment more fully once I have had the chance to hear the whole lecture.

item.title: By: Alan Brill
item.dc:creator: Alan Brill
item.description:
In reply to <a href="https://kavvanah.wordpress.com/2012/06/17/part-2-of-7-rav-soloveitchik-religious-definitions-of-man-and-his-social-institutions-1958/#comment-5258">Lawrence Kaplan</a>.
thanks. Please let me know any others. If you have any answers to my questions, then please let me know. Also do you know anything about the setting in which these talks were given or how the notebooks became the essay Lonely Man of Faith?
item.content:encoded:
In reply to Lawrence Kaplan.

thanks. Please let me know any others. If you have any answers to my questions, then please let me know. Also do you know anything about the setting in which these talks were given or how the notebooks became the essay Lonely Man of Faith?

item.title: By: Lawrence Kaplan
item.dc:creator: Lawrence Kaplan
item.description: Alan: I started listening to the lecture, and have only heard the beginning. You misheard one key sentence. The Rav said "by modern philosophy I do NOT mean contemporary philosophy, but modern philosophy in terms of the enlightenment or age of reason."
item.content:encoded: Alan: I started listening to the lecture, and have only heard the beginning. You misheard one key sentence. The Rav said “by modern philosophy I do NOT mean contemporary philosophy, but modern philosophy in terms of the enlightenment or age of reason.”
